svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - July 6 2024
July 6 2024

title: "Week in Ethereum News
July 6, 2024" date: "2024-07-06"
Eth News and Links
Pectra upgrade size discussion (potentially cap scope)
All core devs
â€¢ All core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) #191 : Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade: pectra-devnet-1 : now expect to launch in 1-2 weeks, locally
tested with 2 execution layer + 3 consensus layer clients EIP7702 : delegation designation proposal to be merged & included in
pectra-devnet-2 RIP7212 secp256r1 precompile : discussion on including in Pectra, whether to use RIP precompile address & what return
value to use; review inclusion at next ACDE EIP7002 EL triggered withdrawals & EIP7251 maxEB : agreed to add events Pectra size discussion
: potentially capping (strong support) or reducing (some support) scope Discussions: history expiry and improving blob transaction
propagation To progress non-upgrade specific features need to target specific devnets, provide updates at all core devs & more breakouts
â€¢ Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade: pectra-devnet-1 : now expect to launch in 1-2 weeks, locally tested with 2 execution layer + 3
consensus layer clients EIP7702 : delegation designation proposal to be merged & included in pectra-devnet-2 RIP7212 secp256r1 precompile
: discussion on including in Pectra, whether to use RIP precompile address & what return value to use; review inclusion at next ACDE
EIP7002 EL triggered withdrawals & EIP7251 maxEB : agreed to add events Pectra size discussion : potentially capping (strong support) or
reducing (some support) scope
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade:
â€¢ pectra-devnet-1 : now expect to launch in 1-2 weeks, locally tested with 2 execution layer + 3 consensus layer clients
pectra-devnet-1 : now expect to launch in 1-2 weeks, locally tested with 2 execution layer + 3 consensus layer clients

devnets, provide updates at all core devs & more breakouts
Discussions: history expiry and improving blob transaction propagation
â€¢ To progress non-upgrade specific features need to target specific devnets, provide updates at all core devs & more breakouts
Osaka + F starname upgrade
â€¢ Verkle implementers call #20 : blockhash handling to use EIP4788 behavior, sync during transition needs to be combination of snap & full
sync and avoiding extra EOF extcodesize/hash costs
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
â€¢ ðŸš¨ Lido at 29.2% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 29.2% , still too close to 33.3% threshold
â€¢ Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority Consensus layer: Prysm 37% Any client bug over 33.3%
could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
â€¢ Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~55% majority
â€¢ Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
â€¢ Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
â€¢ Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal, particularly outside of North America & Europe
Layer 1
â€¢ Vitalik: faster transaction confirmation times via Single Slot Finality & rollup/based preconfirmations
Vitalik: faster transaction confirmation times via Single Slot Finality & rollup/based preconfirmations
â€¢ EIP7732 ePBS: ePBS breakout #4 : EIP created, pull request for consensus specs, withdrawal processing complications and bid gossip p2p
DoS vulnerability Terence: fork choice attacks in ePBS Potuz: benefits of ePBS
EIP7732 ePBS:
â€¢ ePBS breakout #4 : EIP created, pull request for consensus specs, withdrawal processing complications and bid gossip p2p DoS
vulnerability
ePBS breakout #4 : EIP created, pull request for consensus specs, withdrawal processing complications and bid gossip p2p DoS vulnerability
â€¢ Terence: fork choice attacks in ePBS
Terence: fork choice attacks in ePBS
â€¢ Potuz: benefits of ePBS
Potuz: benefits of ePBS
â€¢ Dapplion: fetch blobs from execution layer pool proposal, rather than wait for blobs over gossipsub
Dapplion: fetch blobs from execution layer pool proposal, rather than wait for blobs over gossipsub
â€¢ Flashbots rbuilder : MEV-Boost block builder in Rust
Flashbots rbuilder : MEV-Boost block builder in Rust
â€¢ Gossipsub performance: bandwidth consumption and message propagation latency
Gossipsub performance: bandwidth consumption and message propagation latency
Client Releases
â€¢ Execution layer: Geth v1.14.6 : adds experimental stateless witness builder & (self) cross validator
â€¢ Geth v1.14.6 : adds experimental stateless witness builder & (self) cross validator
For Stakers
â€¢ Obol Charon v1 : distributed validator middleware
Obol Charon v1 : distributed validator middleware

EIPs/Standards
â€¢ EIPs (Ethereum improvement proposals): EIP7732 : Enshrined proposer-builder separation (ePBS) EIP7735 : Gas fee sponsorship EIP7736 :
Leaf-level state expiry in verkle trees

Stuff for developers
â€¢ Foundry forge-std v1.9.0 : adds cheatcodes for a uint prompt, generate a random address/uint, invariant excludeSelector helper and
deprecates console2; v1.9.1 : adds missing console logs
Foundry forge-std v1.9.0 : adds cheatcodes for a uint prompt, generate a random address/uint, invariant excludeSelector helper and
â€¢ EVMRepl (formerly Gas Playground): adds Solidity compilation errors
EVMRepl (formerly Gas Playground): adds Solidity compilation errors
â€¢ Wevm webauthn-p256 (TypeScript): P256 signature utilities for WebAuthn
Wevm webauthn-p256 (TypeScript): P256 signature utilities for WebAuthn
â€¢ Stealth Address SDK v1 beta (TypeScript): work with EIP5564 & EIP6538 stealth addresses
Stealth Address SDK v1 beta (TypeScript): work with EIP5564 & EIP6538 stealth addresses
Security
â€¢ Immunefi Safe Harbor : implementation of Security Alliance (SEAL) whitehat safe harbor framework
Enterprise
â€¢ Societe Generale-FORGE EURCV stablecoin no longer permissioned to use
Job Listings
â€¢ Aragon: Senior Smart Contract Developer
Aragon: Senior Smart Contract Developer
â€¢ Privacy and Scaling Explorations: ZK Circuits Engineer

Onchain stats
â€¢ Fees (via ultrasound.money ): Gas: 1.1 to 73.4 gwei, 5.5 gwei average; zero net issuance at 23.8 gwei 14k ETH net issuance this week

Notable at app layer
â€¢ Element DAOâ€™s Hyperdrive (fixed/variable rate 6 month yields) live on mainnet

Regulation/business/tokens
â€¢ Judge dismissed SEC claim that secondary BNB sales are securities, in case against Binance
Judge dismissed SEC claim that secondary BNB sales are securities, in case against Binance
â€¢ Circle USDC/EURC stablecoins EU MiCA compliant with reserves held in Europe
Circle USDC/EURC stablecoins EU MiCA compliant with reserves held in Europe
â€¢ Logan Paul sues Coffeezilla for defamation over CryptoZoo reporting
Logan Paul sues Coffeezilla for defamation over CryptoZoo reporting
â€¢ German government moved 2k BTC & Mt Gox moved 47k BTC
German government moved 2k BTC & Mt Gox moved 47k BTC
General
â€¢ EF updates mailing list compromised to email link to crypto drainer
EF updates mailing list compromised to email link to crypto drainer
â€¢ Twilio: Authy account data (including phone numbers) identified via unauthenticated endpoint
Twilio: Authy account data (including phone numbers) identified via unauthenticated endpoint
â€¢ regreSSHion : OpenSSH server remote code execution vulnerability
regreSSHion : OpenSSH server remote code execution vulnerability
